page.title: 11Shopping in Rutland
page.content:
For the purposes of this survey, Harringworth is included with the two Rutland villages of Bisbrooke and Seaton. It is the only one of the three villages with a shop. Local people use this shop, but many go into the neighbouring towns of Uppingham, Stamford, and Corby for main grocery shopping in supermarkets.
The Harringworth shop is a Post Office and General Store. It is also an off-licence. Fruit and vegetables are bought from Uppingham Market to be resold there. The shop also sells daily papers, sweets, toys, general foods and Calor gas. It acts as a branch of the National Savings Bank ans National Giro Bank. It does not sell eggs, furniture or clothes.
